name: anemone-hortensis-st-bavo
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
fruit-description: This plant has small fruits often with plumose tails.
flower-description: Flowers are scarlet to magenta (although they can also be white, yellow-green, red, or purple), bloom in mid-spring (April), and have poppy-like blooms with a large dark central disk. The flowers are cup-shaped with 5-many petal-like parts and many stamens.
leaf-description: This plant has clumps of divided, ferny leaves. This plant has alternate or whorled and finely divided leaves.
poison-symptoms:
TOXIC ONLY IF LARGE QUANTITIES EATEN. CAUSES SEVERE PAIN IN THE MOUTH IF EATEN!
Poisonous through ingestion and dermatitis. (Poisonous parts:     All parts when fresh).
Symptoms may include:     Inflammation and blistering upon contact with fresh sap; irritation of mouth, vomiting and diarrhea following ingestion.
